name: lizjones
text: Brilliant.

name: chaesar
text: Word, I mean who the hell needs to make a balance transfer for less than $45 anyway?

name: tekende
text: I can't believe I am still the only person that has chubbied this comment. Does no one else see this comment? Am I taking crazy pills or something? This comment is funny!

name: tekende
text: Goodness, 30 chubbies. I didn't think I had this kind of power...

name: fineoakstructure
text: It's the internet.  Lots of idiots become influential, tekende.

name: nsrdude
text: A comment left by nsrdude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, johnnybaverage, straw, Carlyle, The_Prophet, Sakana, jstegall, bearattack, wurlitzergirl, rowboat, mortshire, bug, fireteddy, jollysaintpete, ActualTaunt, NDCaesar, gtc, fancypants, mymy, atticusonline, dinner, LaserBlade, mashuren, Tragic_Johnson, kenyot, mrblank91, mendenbar, eRiUukFJk, Doc_Rostov, trawser, pigeon_street, afvbs)

name: zefiel
text: I wonder if Onstad's got an official stance on this. The info when you google search achewood does mention a retarded otter, but i don't think Philippe is actually impaired.

name: nsrdude
text: A comment left by nsrdude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Shinkusan, riotdejaneiro, gtc, atticusonline, dinner, LaserBlade, trawser, stormagnet)

name: huber
text: Phillipe is retarded? I always just thought he was 5

name: nsrdude
text: A comment left by nsrdude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, johnnybaverage, The_Prophet, Erutangis, riotdejaneiro, wurlitzergirl, StagnantDisplay, rowboat, bug, _cheesekayke, ActualTaunt, NDCaesar, gtc, fancypants, atticusonline, dinner, LaserBlade, shoinan, mrblank91, Doc_Rostov, clintisiceman, trawser, stormagnet, alchemicnirvana)

name: mckayle
text: You must not know many five-year-olds.

name: norrin
text: As a high school teacher, I know teenagers who I do not give that much credit to.

name: charchar
text: I am a teenager and I find myself in reluctant accord.  But really, aren't we all just a helmet and some bubbles away from being retarded ourselves?

name: gunsofray
text: I'm pretty sure i'm retarded. And a teenager.

name: rowboat
text: A RETARD COULD NOT DRIVE A VAN WITH HIS TEETH! Wait...maybe that's not the best example.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I submit Philippe's prayer about bed-wetting as proof of his being merely 5, and a rather high-functioning 5 year old at that.
The bit about misting burn victims' lidless eyes? Even taking into consideration his upbringing, that is some heavy stuff for a kid to think about.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Or his imaginings of getting made into dog food, as a result of... a bad choice .

name: quantumcasaba
text: I can not find this strip. I've read it before of course, but I'm trying to send the link to a friend and I cannot find it anywhere by text search. Do you happen to remember the date?

name: brokeaccount
text:
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=08242007

HOW'S THAT FOR SERVICE?

name: quantumcasaba
text:
If you were delivering a pizza, I would actually be legally bound to give you a princely tip, some cigarettes, and half of the pizza.
That is how efficient your service has been.
It is that good.

name: dicklaurent
text: I believe Chris originally meant him to be kinda retarded, but after a while the explanation has mostly been that he is 5.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: He's an otter.

name: nessotron
text: A comment left by nessotron was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, Deusoma, cailetshadow)

name: reneilssance
text: I think the google search info was written a long while ago, as it does not actually mention Ray or Beef being members of the cast.

name: catachresis
text: Telemarketing: It All Makes Sense Now.

name: agika
text: A comment left by agika was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by bearattack, telegramsiam, friendofyou)

name: straw
text: It is really your friends calling you from hell.  They only want to speak with you.  But it is telemarketing.

name: presterjohn
text: I am going to explain this theory to the next telemarketer that calls me and then reminisce with him about shenanigans we had back in small times, before he fell in the thresher.

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: Philippe is just so excited that he finally has the opportunity to use his well practice telephone etiquette, only to squander it on what he thinks is a tele-marketer.

name: aaron_haynes
text:
Here's a hint: it's where the Devil lives!

Genius.

name: nutmeg
text: man, used to call people like that. i worked in hell. for the devil.

name: afkpuz
text:
The booth is Pacific Bell.

I live on the east coast, and find this to be an odd sight.

name: tellumo
text:
Naah, basically all the phone booths out here in CA have that logo on them. Of course, they 've since been bought out a bunch of times . . .

Never having had wireline phone service out here, I can't say whether I find it likely they would be the official phone company of Hell or not. Maybe Ray and Beef ended up in the California Hell or something.

name: mattylite
text: In California Hell the fire and brimstone comes with avocados and sun-dried tomatos.

name: tellumo
text: And hella red wine.

name: hollis
text: This is where telemarketing comes from.

name: schroedingrscat
text: The only strip in which Beef's spoken words are even slightly punctuated.

name: philosophe
text: Before he was developed as a character and was only seen with Ray and Pat, he had punctuation.

name: dovey
text: Of late, Beef has had punctuation (check the strip where he's hell of pissed off about the price of marriage), but it's always been spaced away from the preceding text, like it's not comfortable existing in his speech

name: dovey
text: Actually it's like that in the very next strip after this one.

name: zem
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: mountaindewtab
text: This is Genius! my eyes are welling up with tears!

name: lawbot
text: That is a very special Philippe face in the last panel. This is a scientific fact.

name: peterjoel
text: There have been 7-eleven stores in hell for several centuries. The first non-dead franchise was opened by Joe Thompson in Dallas, in 1927. Heaven does not have 7-eleven, due to regulations on Sunday trading.

name: goddessdictator
text: I love 7-elevens. in los angeles there is one every 50 feet. go look. its is my favorite thing.

name: rothenbergxxx
text: This is such a good comic.

name: laikalost
text:
All those phonecalls from telemarketers may in-fact be old aquaintences calling us from hell?

Show me a comic that achieves that same level a subtle brilliance. I dare you. 5.

name: starrtennis
text:
The contrast in Philippe's words, facial expression, and implied tone of voice between panels 4 and 6 are so great.

Oh man. <3 Phillipe. So innocent and light-hearted, yet so capable of getting down and dealing with the business as necessary.

name: fixipoo
text: Gave me a good laugh.

name: almightygosh
text: Sweet!

name: drago25
text: I love the versatility of phones in the Achewood universe

name: jezebel
text:
I asked my boss if I could answer the phone like this when clients called. She didn't seem very enthusiastic.

I wonder if I explained I was inspired by a five year-old possibly slightly retarded talking stuffed otter would help...

name: lollipopsichord
text: the devil is one sly dog.

name: mrectomy
text: So much win.

name: rykan
text:
I've been there.


It's true.

name: nilehus
text:
Nice touch, the italics from panel 5 carrying over to their translation in panel 6.

May just be a coincidence, but either way, it's cool.

name: allanpinkerton
text: This is one of my favorite ideas put forth in Achewood.  Telemarketers are actual hellions.

name: trotz
text: Of course!  Telemarketing makes so much sense now!

name: carlyle
text: Fived for Philippe's face.

name: lolsworth
text: This explains so much

name: stubob
text: If telemarketers are calling from hell, where are my creditors calling from?  Some lower hell perhaps?

name: tekende
text: Maybe you should worry more about paying your debts than where the creditors are located.

name: soupkitchen
text: one of the funnier things i've seen in a lifetime

name: lungfish
text: Having worked in call centers for a very long time, I enjoyed this strip a little more than intended.
